page.title: 04ROTHERHAM GENERAL HOSPITAL
page.content: {Rotherham General Hospital Rotherham's new hospital comes under the aegis of the Trent hospital board. The first two phases of the building were completed and commissioned in 1978 and 1984 respectively. The third phase of the development is to be included in the 1985/86 building programme. There wil be extensions to the accident, X ray, and out-patients departments and improvements on operating theatres, reception and recovery rooms. There is to be a new Endoscopy unit. Forward planning into the 1990's has provided for a long stay mental illness unit and geriatric and obstetric units. The hospital has 780 beds and utilises a staff of over 1,500,- 120 administrative and clerical staff-106 medical staff, 592 nursing and midwifery staff and 406 ancillary workers.
